Description: A number of short cylindrical beads: of generally uniform diameter in green glazed steatite, two shell disc beads, many cornelian barrel and disc beads of twice the diameter and a cornelian drop pendant.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Badari, el-, Grave 5449 Found in a male burial
Curator's comments: Bibliography: G. Brunton & G. Caton-Thompson, ‘The Badarian Civilization’ (London, 1928), Grave register, pl.VII; Bead corpus, pl.XLIX, 75B15; pl.L, 86F14, P8, R14; 89C18; The British Museum, 'Jewellery through 7000 years' [exhibition catalogue] (London, 1976), no. 4.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (61)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
